intro: Eugenia gomezii, commonly known as the Mexican cherry or Guanabana, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and smooth, dark purple to black berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aromatic scent. The fruit is edible and has a sweet, creamy pulp with a strong, tropical flavor.
